page.title: Walk On By (Burt Bacharach and Hal David song)

revisions.rev:
"'''Walk On By'''" is a song composed by [[Burt Bacharach]], with lyrics by [[Hal David]]. The song was originally recorded by, and a hit for, [[Dionne Warwick]]. It has subsequently been covered many times, and has been a hit for several other artists as well, including [[Gloria Gaynor]], [[Alan Price]], [[Isaac Hayes]], [[Average White Band]], [[The Stranglers]], [[D-Train]], [[Jo Jo Zep]], [[Sybil Lynch|Sybil]], Gabrielle, [[Cyndi Lauper]], [[Alicia Keys]] and [[Seal (musician)|Seal]]. ==Charting versions== "Walk On By" has charted numerous times in various countries, with wildly different arrangements. The following entries discuss the chart versions of the song, in the order in which they appeared: ===Dionne Warwick version (1964)=== {{Infobox Single | Name = Walk On By | Cover = | Artist = [[Dionne Warwick]] | from Album = [[Make Way for Dionne Warwick]] | B-side = Any Old Time of Day (Bacharach & David) | Released = April 26, 1964 | Format = 7" single | Recorded = [[1964 in music|1964]] at Bell Sound Studios, November 1963, Ed Smith Engineer | Genre = [[Soul music|Soul]], [[Pop music|pop]] | Length = 2:55 | Label = [[Scepter Records|Scepter]] | Writer = [[Burt Bacharach]]
[[Hal David]] | Producer = Burt Bacharach
Hal David | Last single = "[[Anyone Who Had a Heart (song)|Anyone Who Had a Heart]]"
(1963) | This single = "'''Walk on By'''"
(1964) | Next single = "[[You'll Never Get to Heaven (If You Break My Heart)]]"
(1964) }} The original version of "Walk On By" was recorded at the same December 1963 session that yielded "[[Anyone Who Had a Heart (song)|Anyone Who Had a Heart]]", which, in 1964, became Warwick's second Top Ten hit. Released in April of that year, "Walk on By" became a [[landmark]] single, reaching number six on the U.S. [[Billboard Hot 100]] and number one hit Cashbox's R&B chart.{{cite book |title= Top R&B/Hip-Hop Singles: 1942-2004|last=Whitburn |first=Joel |authorlink=Joel Whitburn |year=2004 |publisher=Record Research |page=609}} (Billboard did not print rhythm and blues charts during 1964, the year of the song's peak performance.) The song also reached the top 10 in a brief run on Billboard's easy listening survey. Warwick also recorded a German version of the song, entitled "Geh Vorbei". [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AnwtYxccwMw Geh Vorbei (Walk On By)] on [[YouTube]] {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1964) !Peak
position |- |US Hot 100 |align="center"|6 |- |US R&B |align="center"|1 |- |US A/C |align="center"|7 |- |[[UK Singles Chart]] |align="center"|8 |- |} ===Isaac Hayes version (1969)=== [[Funk]]/soul musician [[Isaac Hayes]] 1969 cover on his groundbreaking album ''[[Hot Buttered Soul]]'' transformed the song into a twelve-and-a-half minute funk vamp. Edited for single release down to under 5 minutes, this single reached #30 on the US charts. {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1978) !Peak
position |- |US Hot 100 |align="center"|30 |- |} ===Stranglers version (1978)=== In 1978, [[The Stranglers]] recorded a gritty punk-inspired version (with an extended organ solo) that hit #21 on the UK charts. {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1978) !Peak
position |- |[[UK Singles Chart]] |align="center"|21 |- |} ===D-Train version (1982)=== In 1982, funk duo [[D-Train]] recorded a UK and US R&B/dance hit with the song in a [[boogie (genre)|boogie]]/funk cover. {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1982) !Peak
position |- |[[UK Singles Chart]] |align="center"|44 |- |US R&B |align="center"|42 |- |US Dance |align="center"|45 |- |} ===Jo Jo Zep version (1983)=== In 1983, Australian act [[Jo Jo Zep]] covered the song in a slow, moody version that featured electronics and synthesizers. The track was a minor hit in Australia, peaking at #55, but was a major hit in New Zealand, hitting #6. {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1983) !Peak
position |- |Australia |align="center"|55 |- |New Zealand |align="center"|6 |- |} === Sybil version (1990)=== In 1990, singer [[Sybil Lynch|Sybil]], who had scored her biggest hit a year prior with a cover of Warwick's "[[Don't Make Me Over (song)|Don't Make Me Over]]", also scored a US and UK hit with "Walk On By". {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1990) !Peak
position |- |[[UK Singles Chart]] |align="center"|6 |- |US Hot 100 |align="center"|74 |- |US R&B |align="center"|3 |- |US Dance |align="center"|3 |- |} ===Gabrielle version (1997)=== {{Infobox Single | Name = Walk on By | Cover = Gabrielle_-_Walk_On_By.jpg | Artist = [[Gabrielle (singer)|Gabrielle]] | from Album = [[Gabrielle (album)|Gabrielle]] | Released = January 7 1997 | Format = [[CD single]] | Recorded = 1995 | Genre = [[pop music|Pop]], [[contemporary R&B|R&B]], [[soul music|soul]] | Length = 3:21 | Label = [[Go Beat]], [[Universal Records]] | Producer = | Last single = "[[If I Ever Fall in Love#.22If You Ever.22|If You Ever]]"
(1996) | This single = "'''Walk on By'''"
(1997) | Next single = "[[Sunshine (Gabrielle song)|Sunshine]]"
(1999) }} In 1997, [[United Kingdom|UK]] singer [[Gabrielle (singer)|Gabrielle]] released her version of "Walk on By" as the fifth and final single from her second self-titled album. It reached #7 in the UK. {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1997) !Peak
position |- |[[UK Singles Chart]] |align="center"|7 |- |[[Dutch Singles Chart]] |align="center"|96 |- |} ====Track listing==== '''UK CD: (GODCD 159)''' # "Walk on By" # "Walk on By" (45% Novocaine remix) # "Walk on By" (live from [[TFI Friday]]) # "Something to Talk About" ===Cyndi Lauper version (2003)=== {{Infobox Single | Name = Walk on By | Cover = Walk On By Cyndi Lauper.jpg | Caption = | Artist = [[Cyndi Lauper]] | Album = [[At Last (Cyndi Lauper album)|At Last]] | Published = | Released = 2003 | track_no = | Recorded = [[2003 in music|2003]] | Genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] | Length = | Writer = [[Burt Bacharach]], [[Hal David]] | Label = [[Sony Records]] | Producer = | Tracks = | prev = [[At Last (song)|At Last]] | prev_no = 1 | next = [[Stay (Maurice Williams song)|Stay]] | next_no = 3 | Misc = }} "Walk on By" was the first single from [[Cyndi Lauper]]'s [[2003 in music|2003]] covers album, ''[[At Last (Cyndi Lauper album)|At Last]]''. It was also included on Lauper's [[2004 in music|2004]] DVD ''Live at Last''. It was released as a promo only. Remixes of the song reached #10 on the U.S. dance chart. {| class="wikitable" !Chart (2004) !Peak
position |- |U.S. ''Billboard'' [[Hot Dance Club Play]] |align="center"|10 |- |} ====Track listing==== '''CD:''' # "Walk on By" (Eddie X club mix) 10:51 # "Walk on By" (Eddie X dub mix) 7:52 # "Walk on By" (live version) 3:26 # "Walk on By" (S.A.F. dub mix) 8:12 # "Walk on By" (S.A.F.'s Walk to the Dance Floor club mix) 8:10 # "Walk on By" (Tony Moran mix) 4:31 ===Seal version (2005)=== {{Infobox Single | Name = Walk on By | Cover = SealWalkOnBy.JPG | Caption = | Artist = [[Seal (musician)|Seal]] | from Album = [[Best 1991-2004 (album)|Best 1991-2004]] | A-side = | B-side = | Released = January 5, 2005 | Format = CD single | Recorded = [[2005 in music|2005]] | Genre = [[Soul music|Soul]], [[Pop music|pop]] | Length = | Label = [[Wea]] | Producer = | Certification = | Last single = "Waiting for You"
(2004) | This single = "'''Walk on By'''"
(2005) | Next single = "[[Killer (Adamski song)|Killer 2005]]"
(2005) | Misc = }} Seal released a version of "Walk On By" as a single in January, 2005. Though the song did not chart in his native UK, it made the lower reaches of the charts in several European countries, including #57 Austria, #49 Germany, and #46 Switzerland. == Other versions of note== * The Beach Boys covered the song in a studio outtake included on their 20/20 CD paired with Friends as bonus track from that period. * A 1960s [[garage rock]] version was recorded by The Outcasts from [[Manhasset, New York]]{{discogs artist|Outcasts, The (5)|The Outcasts from Manhasset, New York}} * [[Melissa Manchester]] covered the song on her ''Tribute'' album (1989) * [[Alicia Keys]] recorded a hip hop version of the song on mutli-platinum album ''[[The Diary of Alicia Keys]]'', (2003) * [[Diana Krall]] recorded a jazzy version of the song on ''Quiet Nights'', (2009) * In 1994, British guitarist [[Peter White (musician)|Peter White]] covered the song off his album ''Reflections''.{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r203471|pure_url=yes}}|title=Reflections overview|work=[[Allmusic|Allmusic.com]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.smoothvibes.com/movabletype/archives/000379.html|title=Reflections CD Sequel Is Next For Peter White|work=[[Allmusic|Allmusic.com]]}} * 3 years later, an instrumentalist named Bob Baldwin covered the song from the 1997 album ''Cool Breeze''.{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r277668|pure_url=yes}}|title=Cool Breeze overview|work=[[Allmusic|Allmusic.com]]}}{{cite web|url=http://www.jazzreview.com/cdreview.cfm?ID=592|title=CD Review of Bob Baldwin - Cool Breeze|work=JazzReview.com}} * [[Ronan Keating]] recorded the song for his album "[[When Ronan Met Burt]]" (2011) * [[Kiki Dee]] recorded Walk On By in 1969 for Motown records during her work on the ''Great Expectations'' album, but the song was not released until 2005. It was then included on the retrospective album ''Kiki Dee - Love Makes The World Go Round: The Motown Collection'' (2005) This recording may be heard on youtube.com (Uploaded by LudaMalaMara on Jul 31, 2011) Link: [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QSYqppyyszU KiKi Dee - Walk On By] ==References== {{reflist}} {{Gabrielle}} {{Cyndi Lauper}} {{Seal (musician)}} [[Category:1964 singles]] [[Category:1997 singles]] [[Category:2003 singles]] [[Category:2005 singles]] [[Category:Dionne Warwick songs]] [[Category:Songs with lyrics by Hal David]] [[Category:Songs with music by Burt Bacharach]] [[Category:Songs produced by Burt Bacharach]] [[Category:Cyndi Lauper songs]] [[Category:Gabrielle songs]] [[Category:Isaac Hayes songs]] [[Category:Seal songs]] [[Category:The Lettermen songs]] [[Category:The Stranglers songs]] [[Category:Grammy Hall of Fame Award recipients]] [[fr:Walk on By]] [[no:Walk on By]] [[pt:Walk On By (canÃ§Ã£o de Dionne Warwick)]] [[sv:Walk on By (Dionne Warwick-lÃ¥t)]]
